dict.string: (?x) \b( (?:[a-z]\w*\.)* # Optional package specification [A-Z]\w+\b # Class name (?:<(?:[\w, ]*)>)? # Optional Generics (?:\[\s*\])* # Optional brackets (array) )\b
In some situations, maps can't be declared without enclosing []'s, therefore we create a collection of everything but that

(?x)^\s* (?: # zero or more modifiers (?: (public|private|protected)|(final)|(native|synchronized|abstract|threadsafe|transient) ) \s+ )? \s* ([A-Z](?:[a-zA-Z0-9_])+) # constructor/class name \s* (?=\()

(?x)^\s* (?: (?: # or modifier and optional type (?:(?:\b(public|private|protected)|(static)|(final)|(native|synchronized|abstract|threadsafe|transient))\b\s+)+\s* # modifier (?:\b (void) | (boolean|byte|char|short|int|float|long|double) # primitive | ( # or class type (?:\w+\.)*[A-Z]\w+\b # Class name (?:<(?:[\w, ]*)>)? # optional Generic type (?:\[\s*\])* # zero or more square brackets (array) ) )? ) | (?:\b # or type by itself (def) | (void) | (boolean|byte|char|short|int|float|long|double) # primitive | ( # or class type (?:\w+\.)*[A-Z]\w+\b # Class name (?:<(?:[\w, ]*)>)? # optional generics info (?:\[\s*\])* # zero or more square brackets (array) ) ) ) \s* (\w+) # method name \s* (?=\() # opening parens
